Articles.Content:
I don't know if this belongs in off topic but it is related to kerbal so i put it here

Today i was launching my model rockets with a new onboard camera we(me and my dad) bought. During the flight the rocket peaked and deployed but the parachute never fully opened staying in a drouge state much like kerbal space program. Suddenly the parachute opened about 50 - 100 ft off the ground replicating the function of a Kerbal parachute.

Video here

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LEPbsxL5dE&feature=youtu.be

I totally thought it was done for, nice job!

I never managed to build a scrap 2-stage rocket myself, just 1 :/
yeah but it did lose a fin on impact
I built an illegal solid rocket motor, and subsequently blew up a vegetable patch. The pilot, a snail, survived though. Maybe snails are related to kerbals?

yeah but it did lose a fin on impact

that just makes it even more kerbal, now get to work on making them explode when they land

I remember in high school physics class we had a goal of building a rocket that could send an egg and bring it back to the surface safely.

The egg met a kerbal ending..

Also relating to Kerbal we also launched a modified V2 model rocket with a spacious payload with a mouse in it. don't worry luckily this mouse shares much in common with Jeb and survived the ride without a scratch. He got a piece of cheese afterward.

video here

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N9wZYRhlll8&list=UU4006u4zxveMe5EpPF3PFHg&index=1&feature=plcp

skip to 1:05 for launch

I built an illegal solid rocket motor, and subsequently blew up a vegetable patch. The pilot, a snail, survived though. Maybe snails are related to kerbals?

Been there, done that.

'Home built rocket motor' generally translates to 'bomb' in my past experiences. heh.

I remember in high school physics class we had a goal of building a rocket that could send an egg and bring it back to the surface safely.

The egg met a kerbal ending..

LOL! I did a familiar task in mid-school, had no idea if it would fly, yet it did (I called it Soyuz) xD

Some help would have been be great too.

Far back in forum history, there was the tale of KSP's origins in some real-life fireworks rocket launches:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/4887-Background-of-KSP?p=62787&viewfull=1#post62787

At some point there was a picture posted of some old drawings Moach had found of the fireworks testing, but that post seems to have been lost due to forums moves over time!

-------

Never mind, found it!

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/8995-I-have-found-it!!-THE-ORIGINAL-KERBO-LOG!

Edited October 15, 2012 by khyron42
